name: The Athens Gate Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights in this superbly located hotel - a beautiful10 minute walk & you're at the Acropolis Museum or a little further, and you're at the entrance to the Acropolis. The restored Plaka district is fascinating. Breakfast or dinner from the rooftop terrace was extraordinary - we looked either to the Temple of Zeus of the Parthenon. The service was professional and wonderful, the rooms were spacious and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Temple of Zeus or Parthenon?

reviews.text: Was here in late October. The hotel has a retro lobby and elevator, which adds to the appeal. The rest of the hotel has been well renovated. The rooms are very comfortable and the bathroom very modern, minimalist and practical with ample room. The size of the room is typical of European hotels.
reviews.title: Great location and nice hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The view from the rooftop restaurant was splendid and unforgettable. It must be one of the great views of the world. I found the breakfast tasty and adequate, however, I found a waitresses rude to some of the patrons, which was unusual, as the staff in the hotel were very helpful, nice and very responsive.
reviews.title: Great Location!
Central location, great service and beautiful rooms
reviews.text: The hotel is centrally located, only a short walk from the amazing Acropolis museum and the metro station. Syntagma Square is a ten minute walk.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only issue with the hotel was an intermittent noise in my room (ostensibly from the air recycling system) that turned on for five-ten minutes approximately every 90 minutes. It even woke me at night. Staff were sensitive to my issue and offered me another room, where I experienced the same problem. Everyone I met at the hotel had no issue with noise in the room, and some had been here many times. It is the only thing that prevents me giving this excellent hotel 5 stars.
reviews.title: excellent location

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of many of the sites. However, the thing that struck me the most was how helpful the staff here is. We stayed 7 nights and had contacts with many of the front desk staff, bellmen, housekeepers, and restaurant staff in the Rooftop Garden. From the time we walked in we felt appreciated and they were all very willing to answer our questions and even offer up options or solutions that we hadn't thought of. Our bellman conversed with us and showed us how many things work in our room. He also took us out onto our balcony to point out where things are and how best to get there. We felt comfortable from the start. The housekeeping staff had our room looking immaculate each day. All staff at the front desk were more than willing to help us with directions or information about tourist attractions. Before we'd leave the building, they made sure we were set for the day without being overly attentive. The breakfast was just what we needed to start each day, lots of variety and plenty of beautiful views!
reviews.title: Great service and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone!
reviews.title: The Athens Gate Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three nights at The Athens Gate Hotel. Our room was very nice. The best part was that we were within walking distance of just about everything. The view from the rooftop restaurant was spectacular, especially at night.
reviews.title: Perfect Place to Stay!

reviews.text: We had originally (back in March) booked another hotel in the same area but then in August chose to change to the Athens Gate! We made the right decision. Having been cautioned by other reviews of traffic noise in rooms on the front side of the hotel might be bothersome, we requested and received a room on the backside. Our room was on the 6th floor and we were greeted by a beautiful view of the Acropolis with the Parthenon most prominent!
reviews.title: You can't get a better view than this!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived around 11am and were quite pleased to find our room was ready! Yeah and yippee! After a long overnight flight, what we most needed was a nap. Like most European hotels we've heard or read about, the room was small, however, it was quite adequate for our needs... After all, we didn't spend much time there. The room was clean and quite comfortable. We had no issues with the air conditioning.
reviews.title: Anniversary Fun in Athens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel was fantastic. From the roof bar and restaurant you could see the Acropolis, Temple of Zeus and Hadrian's Arch. We were about 1 block from where all of these started. Also the hotel was very clean, helpful, quiet and safe. I have never had a lecture from the porter about leaving everything in the safe before! It was a smart idea! Athens was a surprise to me because I LOVED IT!! The price of this hotel was also resonable and I would really reccomend it.
reviews.title: Views from here fantastic

reviews.text: Perfect hotel to see Athens!
reviews.title: Perfect for sight seeing. Location, location, location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, no need for public transport. Excellent with a great view.
reviews.title: Great central Athens hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here based on Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed. Room allocated at rear on sixth floor overlooking Acropolis with balcony. Nice and quiet, stunning view.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in perfect location

reviews.text: Lovely helpful staff. Particular thanks to the two young ladies who served us at breakfast and dinner.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

reviews.text: We stayed at Athens Gate for 1nite Sept 23rd. The location could not have been any better. You can walk to all the major attractions from the hotel (which we did in one day). The roof deck restaurant was great the view of the Acropolis not to be beaten! The breakfast was fantastic one of the better we had on our trip. They had lots of fruits, cheese, eggs, pastries, breads, etc. My only suggestion is if your a light sleeper ask for room in back of hotel. Street side can be a little noisy. ( it's a city but I always seem to forget to ask)
reviews.title: Perfect location, clean modern rooms, beautiful roof top restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a retired, 72 year old, American who travelled recently to Italy and Greece for three weeks with my wife of many years. We are seasoned travelers. In October we stayed three nights at the Athens Gate hotel. We ate every night in the rooftop restaurant, for the view more than for the food. The hotel has an extremely helpful staff that was always kind, and courteous, the rooms are very comfortable, modern and a good value. We chose a room without a view to find one that was quiet, an important consideration for my wife and I. We had to leave to catch a flight very early in the morning. The hotel kept us up to date on the many strikes that may have proved a problem, provided a breakfast for us to take and called a cab. We had no problems. The view from the restaurant was spectacular! It is an excellent place to stay while you visit the local attractions, all of which are close.
reviews.title: Outstanding location and incredible view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Athens gate hotel was in an excellent location with great views of the acropolis from the restaurant level. it is a great place to have a drink and enjoy the view. It is also within walking distance of a good shopping district with great restaurants. We took a one day taxi cab tour of the city and we saw a lot of things in the one day. Could not have seen them all in a walking tour. It was excellent. I really enjoyed the city. We had heard that Athens was dirty and smoggy but we did not see any of that. We heard that the city is a lot cleaner than it was 20 years ago due to moving out some industries, putting exhaust controls on the cars, and trying to control the traffic. It was a great city to visit. We did not go in the subway but I would have liked to.
reviews.title: Excellent location in Athens

reviews.text: I am repeating what everyone else has said but Athens Gate seems to have it all - views, location, comfort, helpful staff...since no place is perfect, I will say that the bed was a tad bit hard...but every other bed in Greece was also so I guess it is a Greek thing! I asked for (and got) a room in the back w/ a view of the Acropolis...Just a block away is a pedestrian street, which takes you to the Acropolis museum and many outdoor cafes. Perfection! If I went back to Athens, there is no question where I would stay.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: I stayed in the Athens Gate hotel for 3 days. It is a very well located hotel by the Temple of Zeus. The view can be amazing if you pay for such room or you get upgraded, like I was.
reviews.title: very nice hotel with great view

description: The Athens Gate Hotel is located in the historic district of Athens, exactly opposite the Temple of Olympian Zeus. It is 400 m away from the Acropolis, 200 m away from the new Acropolis Museum, and on the doorstep of Plaka, the heart of the tourist district of Athens. It has recently been taken over by new management, and fully renovated. Its style is modern and simple, as befits the area. New features include LCD TV in all rooms.
